column4: i made a partition from my windows drive, and i want to add it to my linux partition, how do i go about it?
you want to access your files from linux on your windows partition?
no, i want to add it to my linux partition
the present linux partition is only 15GB, i want to add 10 gb more
easy program for that then. =) gpart
yeah i know that, was wondering if i would end up having troubles with grub
and i would have to change fstab?
its actually for my friend, i know how to do all that, but hes a noob, was wondering if theres an easy method so that he could do it on his own
editing /boot/grub/menu.lst should be fairly straightforward
yeah
is your friend at all computer literate? being a computer noob and being a linux noob are very different :)
linux noob :)

okay, then what I might suggest to him is to go ahead and comment out the entries in grub for windows, making sure the default is set to ubuntu of course, then go ahead and merge the partitions with gpart
ah yes, but I forgot one thing. he's going to need additional packages for gpart in order to manage NTFS filesystems
hes using gparted, it has ntfstools i guess
which I'm assuming he's using. a simple search for ntfs in package manager should turn up something though
awesome, all set then?
yeah, trying it out now
btw, if you have problems with gparted and ntfs that package was ntfsprogs. libntfs isn't used by gparted :(
using the livecd, i guess it has all what we need :)
awesome. =)
